reviews.sentence: Excellent Hotel. Recently stayed 2 nights in a junior suite. Great room with great views. We have stayed here before and even though it is expensive it is worth paying that bit extra. The staff are very efficient look after every need. The place oozes quality without being stuck up. Breakfast is all served to the table and there is a good choice. We did have a problem with noise from the restaurant refurbishment but this was dealt with superbly by one of the Managers Jack Conroy. This will definitely be our London hotel of choice next time we visit.

Good Modern Hotel. One Aldwych is a reliable modern hotel with pleasant rooms and good bathrooms. It may however benefit from some refurbishment in certain areas to continue to compete with other London hotels in a similar price range. overall very good.

Great location fantastic service friendly staff. Everything started with a deception but then our stay at One Aldwych turned out to be our best stay ever in London We chose One Aldwych because of its location the swimming pool and sauna. Just after we had reserved our room we received a message notifying us about the renovation of the swimming pool during our stay. When we told the hotel that we were not happy about this they upgraded our room invited us for breakfast and made it possible for us to go swimming in the nearby Savoy hotel. The rooms at One Aldwych are nice and very clean. The staff is very friendly and the concierge helped us to get tickets for a sold out musical. We enjoyed a delicious Afternoon Tea inspired by Charly and the Chocolate Factory with the view on the Lyceum Theatre where The Lion King is played.
Fantastic location. Pool and spa great. Location spot on. Bed too hard. Bathroom ok but shower needed updating. Needs a nespreso in the room.

Uniformly courteous service amply spacious rooms great location. My son and I travelled to London for a short stay mixing business and a spot of touring. At a clients recommendation we stayed at One Aldwych. it is in the heart of the West End theatre district very convenient for many of the newer office complexes west of The City and a 15 minute or less walk from most of the core tourist destinations. The staff were uniformly courteous the concierge was helpful. The price was reasonable for all that if not cheap. I would return very happily. I will note that while the exterior of the building is old the interior of the hotel is entirely redone. Modern not historical ambiance. But I leave that to your taste.

Good hotel Needs Renovation Incredible Location. Let me start by saying this hotel has a wonderful staff from management down to everyone else. They all aim to please and for the most part all do their jobs well. One thing that that this hotel has that many in London do not is a fantastic location. It is right at Covent Garden with all the theaters nearby and Covent Garden shopping. Within easy walking distance is the National Gallery Trafalgar Square the Churchill War Rooms the British Museum Regents Park Hyde Park and the War Museum plus a ton of quality restaurants. The room was wonderful except for the bathroom and the curtain design. The bathroom needs serious renovation and according to the staff that is coming soon. The problem is two fold. The tub is deep and you need to use it to shower. There is no curtain just a moving glass screen at the shower end of the tub and that screen leaks water on to the floor. It makes for a dangerous situation especially if you are not a 6 footer 18 m because of the depth of the tub and the difficulty of getting in and out. I do have an issue that most hotel rooms across the world do not have a place for 2 suitcases and a couple of smaller bags to be off the floor and opened and this hotel is no exception. As to the curtain design when we arrived in the room in the evening the one side of the curtain was pulled across the other and held there by pillows propped against it on the floor but there by housekeeping. When we looked further it was clear that you could not draw the curtains tightly against each other to keep out light from shining through early in the morning without following housekeepings lead. We found the breakfast in the dining area had a long way to go before I would consider it good. The afternoon tea was great. I think the food will get better for breakfast as the staff listened to complaints and we have no doubt they intend to improve. If the bathroom and rooms are updated and the issues fixed as promised and the breakfast improved That should be easy. I would not hesitate to return next year.
Absolutely fantastic hotel with wonderful caring attentive staff. Service with a smile made to feel very welcome. Spa changing rooms showers etc could do with a refurb.

Perfect location good service dated and small rooms. The One Aldwych is a small and comfortable luxury hotel perfectly situated in the theatre district. The service and restaurants are very good especially the a la carte breakfast. The downside is that the rooms are small and outdated and therefore currently too expensive compared to their quality. Still this is being taken care of as the hotel will be renovating all rooms in the coming months. We were not bothered by the ongoing renovation work happily.

Good service but too expensive for that offered package. We were several days in this hotel. The service is very good and courteous. The bar food was terrible sorry. I had nothing to pay that was an good reaction from the bar manager. I can recommend the hotel but in my opinion the hotel is a little bit to expensive for what they offered. The rooms are very small for that price. Maybe after the renovation the rooms are more worth its price. The food at Eneko was outstanding and is worth a visit.

The staff indicated that the property was going to undergo a significant remodel in the first half of 2019 and it is clearly needed. The rooms were dated and cramped with none of the comforts you had expect from a modern business hotel. I will refrain from pointing out the myriad details about the hotel that were wanting in nearly every regard as I expect they will all be addressed during the refurbishment. What I WILL mention is that the service and the staff were absolutely exceptional. They were kind helpful and wonderful in every way. They deserve a pristine modern establishment to run and hopefully that is what they will get soon enough.
Lovely spot with friendly classy staff. Beautiful old bank building redone. A nice afternoon tea experience.

Truly Exceptional Service and Excellence. Previous reviews have said it all. The service in this hotel is truly exceptional every member of staff was attentive and respectful. We waited for nothing. However two stood out the concierge and the receptionist on our day of arrival. lunchtime 5819 sorry do not know names. The Rooms are beautifully refurbished quiet cool and the beds very comfortable. We had breakfast twice lovely food in a quiet restaurant with attentive staff. Unfortunately we could not take dinner as we had commitments elsewhere. The cocktail bar was immaculate relaxing atmosphere and we were delighted to be given a welcome drink olives and nuts as well as our complimentary glass of champagne. The final phase of the refurbishment was underway whilst we were staying we were not aware of it at all no noise or disruption. Excellent central location is good for all Central London attractions but particularly for Covent Garden. We will certainly be back and next time will try dinner as well.

Indigo Restaurant. Spent a wonderful afternoon at this stunning recently refurbished restaurant. Being a coeliac I was spoilt for choice. Delightful gluten free menu I could eat everything and it was most reassuring to have such attentive staff who were very knowledgable about allergies. Food was delicious and presentation of dishes was a joy to the eyes thanks to the expertise of Executive chef Dominic Teague. Laura restaurant operations manager made our day extra special when she found out we were celebrating our Sons GCSE ’s and brought them each a complimentary slice of chocolate cake. We look forward to a return visit.

Independent style and great service from engaged staff makes for a great stay. The hotel has been refurbished and I stayed prior to the makeover and again a few days ago. I recall the care and professionalism of all the staff was a highlight of the previous stay. I d say that somehow the makeover has revitalised the team and the customer service they offer the obvious enthusiasm of the staff to engage and satisfy the expectations and wishes of the guests I was in a group of 6 is a real pleasure. This applied at all levels from the uniformed staff to the bar and restaurant as well as housekeeping. New rooms are smart but smaller than i remember them but less quirky in style than before the refurbishment. Food very good I only had breakfast in houseBar comfortable stylish with a relaxed atmosphere with caring and exceptional staff. My group were treated as valued guests and we look forward to going back again in the future. For those looking for a smart top class hotel with an independent style but without overt pretentiousness i d recommend this hotel.

Fantastic Hotel and staff. We had a fantastic stay at One Aldwych recently. We used it as a base to see a couple of shows in the area. The hotel was fantastic and the staff were amazing. All the staff had been on extensive training whilst the hotel was being refurbished and you could tell. They were extremely polite efficient and helpful. Overall they presented an extremely professional image and the hotel should be very proud of its staff.

Ideal Location comfortable hotel fabulous staff. My husband Adult Daughter and I stayed for two nights in a huge suite to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The hotel has had a recent facelift and is looking fantastic. It is independently owned so it can make it is own style which is comfortable and welcoming. The rooms are elegant and the air. conditioning very efficient. There are lovely details everywhere and wonderful views across London. All the staff are friendly and always speak to you even the behind the scenes people. There are two restaurants. We ate in Indigo which is very well laid out and serves lovely food. It also offers gluten and lactose free foods without any loss of quality. We look forward to returning again soon.

Amazing Location and Ambience. One of my favorite hotels in London. The hotel was recently renovated and the decor is beautifully done. Sophisticated and understated but comfortable. The lobby has a double height space with large windows to the streets. The service is excellent. Once there I walked to everything museums theater restaurants. The pool downstairs for a morning swim is an extra bonus.

Best Hotel Ever. Stayed in London for an event so booked the newly refurbished hotel for 2 nights and was so glad I did. The staff were fantastic and a nice welcome gift from Janine the General Manger made the stay extra special. The service in the bar and restaurant could not be faulted and the cocktail list is amazing. I will be coming back as a regular to London this place will be my new home.
First visit since large refurb. Hotel is very well maintained a number of aesthetic and structural changes to benefit. Lacking real Christmas flair seen in earlier years.

Superb hotel and staff convenient location. This was a great hotel recently renovated helpful staff lovely eating and bar on site. I had come back in a heartbeat. From the booking to the checkout staff were absolutely lovely. Location in Covent Garden is ideal lively close to entertainment restaurants and transit.
